Sequence Information.Peptide Name: FGG(398–413)  (a fragment of fibrinogen; natural AMPs; the American Alligator, crocodilian, reptiles, animals; UCLL1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: The peptide was captured from alligator plasma by a custom-built functionalized hydrogel microparticles followed by de nono sequencing by mass spectrometer. It is 36.8% SIMILAR TOTemporin-1GcActivity: Active against E. coli (EC50 0.332 uM), P. aeruginosa (EC50 7.02 uM), B. cereus (EC50 9.35 uM), and S. aureus (EC50 2.84 uM).SAR: Another further truncated fragment, FGG(401–413), was also identified to be active. Updated 7/2021.
Literature Information.Author: Bishop BM, Juba ML, Devine MC, Barksdale SM, Rodriguez CA, Chung MC, Russo PS, Vliet KA, Schnur JM, van Hoek ML. 2015
Literature Information.Title: Bioprospecting the American Alligator (Alligator mississippiensis) Host Defense Peptidome.
